summary: This document contains summaries of two Victim Services Division meetings held in October 2019 as part of the Epstein investigation. The New York meeting on October 23, 2019, had 28 attendees representing 15 victims and their attorneys. The Miami meeting on October 15, 2019, had 17 attendees representing 10 victims. The document lists attending attorneys and notes victim concerns about information flow, media privacy, and safety.

events.title: New York Victim Meeting
events.description: A Victim Services Division meeting held at 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY, with 28 total attendees representing 15 victims, their support guests, and their attorneys.

events.title: Miami Victim Meeting
events.description: A Victim Services Division meeting held at 2030 SW 145th Avenue, Miramar, FL, with 17 total attendees representing 10 victims, their support guests, and their attorneys.

keyFacts: Two Victim Services Division meetings were held in October 2019 as part of the Epstein investigation: one in New York (Oct 23) and one in Miami (Oct 15).
The New York meeting had 28 attendees representing 15 victims, while the Miami meeting had 17 attendees representing 10 victims.
Several prominent attorneys, including Bradley Edwards, Brittany Henderson, Sigrid McCawley, David Boies, Gloria Allred, Daniel Mullkoft, and Robert C. Josefsberg, were present representing victims.
Victim concerns noted at the Miami meeting included information flow, maintaining privacy from media, and safety/security due to high-profile nature of the case.
The document is part of a series of Victim Services Division records (NY-3027571) related to the Epstein investigation.
